abstract_summ: The novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 is the causative agent of the acute respiratory disease COVID-19, which has become a global concern due to its rapid spread . Increased demand in testing has led to shortage of reagents, supplies, and compromised the performance of diagnostic laboratories in many countries . In this study, we describe an alternative RT-PCR approach for the detection of SARS . We established a reverse transcription digital PCR (RT-dPCR) protocol to detect SARS.2 on 194 clinical pharyngeal swab samples .
